business.headline: Are all digital gold investments at risk after Sebi's warning?Sebi made it clear that while some gold investment options are covered under its rules, many digital gold products operate outside its supervision and can expose investors to serious risks.

Lenskart shares listing today: Will the IPO make a strong market debut?Lenskart's IPO opened on October 31 and closed on November 4, receiving an overwhelming response from investors. The issue was subscribed 28.27 times overall.

Will gold continue to glitter this wedding season?Gold has always been the heart of Indian wedding traditions, but surging prices and evolving tastes are forcing families to rethink their buying strategy. As the wedding season peaks, one question rings loud — will gold still shine bright, and should you buy now or wait?

Thinking of buying digital gold? Sebi warns it's not a regulated productSebi further clarified that investor protection mechanisms applicable to regulated securities will not extend to such unregulated digital gold schemes.

Musk to pocket $1,000,000,000,000. What will he do with all the money?Elon Musk has been one of the world's richest people for several years now. And a $1 trillion pay package, which comes with conditions, will only make him richer. It has led social media to wonder how Musk, who is known not to live an extravagant life, will spend his money.

Wills aren't just for the old. Here's why you should have one tooFor most Indians, a will is something you think about when your hair turns grey, or you are on their deathbeds, but making a will early can be one of the most responsible things you do for your future.

Gold vs real estate: Where should you invest?Safe glitter or solid bricks? Investors have always loved gold and property, but choosing between the two can be tricky. With inflation, demand, and prices on the rise, it's time to ask—where you should put your money.

Adani Power bags Bhagalpur's 2,400 MW project tenderFour qualified bidders participated in the tender, with Adani Power quoting the lowest electricity tariff of Rs 6.075 per kWh (or per unit), sources with direct knowledge of the bidding process said.

Gold trades at around Rs 1.21 lakh per 10 grams: Should you buy or wait?Gold's shine shows no sign of fading as global uncertainty, a weak dollar, and festive demand keep prices high. But should investors buy now or wait for the next dip?
Sensex, Nifty end week in red amid weak global cues and FII sellingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 94.73 points to end at 83,216.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.40 points to close at 25,492.30.

BSE share price jumps nearly 9% despite market slump. Here's what drove the rallyAt the end of the trading session on November 7, BSE shares closed 8.61% higher at Rs 2,666.90 apiece on the NSE, bucking the overall market trend.

Lenskart IPO listing next week: Will it deliver profits or disappoint?Lenskart IPO received a strong response from investors, and was subscribed 28.27 times overall, indicating robust demand across categories.

Not 1, 3, or Rs 5 crore. Here's how much Shiv Nadar donated per day last yearShiv Nadar and his family donated a total of Rs 2,708 crore in the last year, which comes to nearly Rs 7.4 crore per day. This is the fourth time in five years that Nadar has topped the list.

Why urban millennials are renting lifestyle products instead of buying themUrban millennials are rewriting the rules of ownership. Instead of buying lifestyle products, from furniture to gadgets, they're choosing to rent. The reason? Flexibility, affordability, and freedom from long-term commitments.

Planning voluntary retirement under UPS? All you need to knowThe guidelines aim to offer clarity and smoother planning for retirement decisions, ensuring eligible employees understand their rights, timelines, and benefits under UPS.

Groww IPO closes today. Here's what the latest GMP signalsWith the IPO closing today, attention now shifts to final subscription numbers and post-allotment reactions. Analysts expect a modestly positive debut given the strong retail response and steady grey market sentiment.

Financial watchdog to seek RBI's help in IndusInd Bank forex hedging probeAs of now, EOW officials have recorded statements of around 12 people from IndusInd Bank, which includes the former top management and other employees in connection with the ongoing investigations into the accounting lapse at the bank of Rs 2000 crore.

Why a magical 12% SIP may not give you solid returns? Expert breaks it downEither compare everything in nominal terms, without adjusting for inflation, or adjust every single figure — contributions, taxes, fees, and final value — for inflation, says expert.

Gold and silver are rising again. What's driving the fresh rally?On Friday morning, gold futures on the MCX were trading around Rs 1,21 lakh per 10 grams, while silver was trading over Rs 1,48 lakh per kg. Both metals have rebounded from their one-week lows, aided by a weaker US dollar and fresh geopolitical tensions.

Elon Musk's $1 trillion payday sounds huge. But can he actually earn it?To actually collect on this historic paycheque, Musk must achieve what Tesla's board calls "Mars-shot milestones", a suite of operational and financial targets.

entertainment.headline: Tamil film body proposes revenue-sharing for star films, sets OTT release windows The Tamil Film Producers Council has introduced a new revenue-sharing model for big-budget films and implemented additional rules for film releases and industry practices, following decisions at its general body meeting in Chennai.

Team Logan Dean or Jess? Matt Czuchry and Jared Padalecki pick their favourites Actors Matt Czuchry and Jared Padalecki reunite to discuss their experiences on 'Gilmore Girls', the enduring impact of the show, and their perspectives on the ongoing debate surrounding Rory's boyfriends, sharing insights and stories from their time on set.

Bigg Boss Malayalam 7: How Anumol braved PR controversies to win Mohanlal's show The seventh season of Bigg Boss Malayalam ended with notable milestones, including the victory of Anumol and the unprecedented entry of a commoner into the final round. The season drew attention for its diverse contestant pool, tougher tasks, and external PR activity aimed at swaying public opinion.

How Elle Fanning's Thia turns Predator: Badlands into a feminist win Hollywood star, Elle Fanning's Thia in 'Predator: Badlands' brings a fresh feminist twist to the male-centric action-sci-fi franchise, proving that brains, strategy, and silent power can outshine brute force.

Max B reunites with rapper French Montana after 16 years in prison. Watch Harlem rapper Max B has been released from prison after serving 16 years, reuniting with his family, friends, and fellow artist French Montana. The release has generated significant attention, with fans and supporters reacting to the news.

Joe Keery shares story behind officiating wedding in full Stranger Things look Joe Keery, known for his role as Steve Harrington in 'Stranger Things', officiated a wedding for friends Veronica Capaldi and Matt Williams while wearing his character's Scoops Ahoy costume. The ceremony drew widespread attention after photos and videos appeared online.

Chappell's cuss word moment stuns crowd at Rock n' Roll Hall of Fame ceremony Singer Chappell Roan experienced a technical struggle and an on-air expletive during her induction speech for Cyndi Lauper at the 2025 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame ceremony.

Pete Davidson surprises fans on SNL with jokes about ferry fiasco, fatherhood Pete Davidson made an unannounced appearance on 'Saturday Night Live', referencing the financial troubles of his Staten Island ferry investment and commenting on New York City's political landscape, while delivering characteristic humour and direct commentary.

Jimmy Kimmel's wife hurt so much as family backs Trump after suspension Molly McNearney, wife of comedian Jimmy Kimmel, has recently opened up about the strain on her family relationships caused by differing political views, particularly surrounding support for Donald Trump.

Actor Betty Harford, known for roles in Dynasty and The Paper Chase, dies at 98 Betty Harford, acclaimed for her performances in television and film, has died peacefully aged 98. Her legacy spans decades in the entertainment industry, including pivotal roles in popular TV series and films.

Shankar Mahadevan dedicates Grammy-nominated album to late Ustad Zakir Hussain Fusion group Shakti earned two Grammy nominations for their latest album Mind Explosion, marking another global milestone after their 2024 win. Shankar Mahadevan dedicated the honour to the late Ustad Zakir Hussain, calling it a heartfelt tribute to the legend who co-founded the iconic band.

Bigg Boss Malayalam Season 7: Anumol crowned winner, Aneesh is runner-up Anumol has been declared the winner of 'Bigg Boss Malayalam Season 7', with commoner Aneesh as the first runner-up. The season made history by featuring its first-ever commoner finalist and a diverse lineup of contestants.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Abhishek Bajaj and Neelam Giri evicted The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar' turned intense as Salman Khan confronted housemates over their behaviour, exposing gossip and hidden alliances. The night ended with a shocking double eviction - Abhishek Bajaj and Neelam Giri.

Anil Kapoor beams with pride in birthday note to son Harsh: Your journey is unique Anil Kapoor wished son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor on his birthday with an emotional post, praising his individuality and courage to follow his own path.

Yami Gautam celebrates Haq's box office surge, calls it a cherished moment Yami Gautam celebrated 'Haq's strong box-office performance, calling it a success driven purely by word of mouth. The film, inspired by the Shah Bano case, witnessed 100% growth on Day 2 after its theatrical release.

After Australia, Diljit Dosanjh faces fresh threats from Khalistani goons in Auckland Diljit Dosanjh continues to receive threats from banned Khalistani group SFJ after his gesture of touching Amitabh Bachchan's feet sparked controversy.

Bigg Boss Malayalam 7 finale: Anumol and Aneesh lead as fans await winner Bigg Boss Malayalam Season 7 will conclude with its grand finale on November 9, as fans await the announcement of the winner. The final list of contestants has been revealed, and viewers can watch the event live from 7 pm onwards.

Zarine Khan sings Aaj Jaane Ki in video shared by daughter Farah Khan Ali. Watch Zarine Khan, wife of actor-filmmaker Sanjay Khan, died at 81. Daughters Sussanne Khan and Farah Khan Ali paid heartfelt tributes remembering her as their guiding light.

When Anurag Kashyap surprised censor board with a film without violence or abuse Anurag Kashyap shared that when he took his film to the censor board, officials were surprised it didn't include violence or abusive language, which changed his long-held views on censorship. The filmmaker said he now sees the issue as systemic and believes filmmakers must unite to bring reform.

general news.headline: People against tariffs are fools: Trump announces $2,000 dividend for AmericansTrump claimed the country is taking in trillions of dollars from tariffs, with the money set to be used to reduce the $37 trillion national debt. He said the administration would soon begin paying it down while issuing a dividend of at least $2,000 per person.

Mohan Bhagwat says Muslims, Christians can come to RSS but on one conditionRSS chief Mohan Bhagwat clarified that followers of all faiths are welcome to participate in the Sangh as long as they come "as sons of Bharat Mata".

BJP slams namaz at Bengaluru airport, demands action from SiddaramaiahKarnataka BJP spokesperson Vijay Prasad also sought clarification from Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and IT Minister Priyank Kharge over the alleged approval of such an act inside the high-security Bengaluru airport.

Delhi air quality hits season's worst, thick smog, plunging temperatures grip cityAmid the deteriorating pollution levels, the national capital witnessed a protest at India Gate, where parents and children gathered to demand urgent government action to tackle the toxic air crisis.

Watch: Trump's awkward reaction as crowd boos him at NFL gameTrump was shown on the stadium's big screen late in the first half. The crowd erupted into a mix of cheers and jeers, though the boos appeared to dominate. The reaction grew louder when the announcer formally introduced the US President at halftime.

Can't do this mumma: Phone call reveals Jaipur girl's fear before fatal fallDespite repeated complaints by Amayra and her parents about bullying, the teacher allegedly took no action -- even on the day the nine-year-old approached her multiple times before jumping to death.

Shashi Tharoor speaks for himself: Congress distances itself from Advani remarkThe Congress on Sunday distanced itself from party MP Shashi Tharoor's recent comments defending BJP veteran LK Advani, clarifying that his views were personal and did not reflect the party's position.

Hard to digest: Jonty Rhodes worried about Delhi's deteriorating air qualitySouth African cricket legend Jonty Rhodes has joined a growing list of voices expressing alarm over Delhi's poor air quality, calling the capital's pollution levels "hard to digest."

Video: Russian helicopter snaps in two before crashing in Dagestan, 5 killedA Russian Ka-226 helicopter carrying senior defence officials crashed in Dagestan. The helicopter was flying from Kizlyar to Izberbash when it caught fire mid-flight and attempted an emergency landing.

The next wave of layoffs might not be in offices but on the streetsDrones are being used for deliveries in Gurgaon and Bengaluru. Amazon is trying out AI automation at its warehouses. But the 12 million people in India's gig economy are oblivious of that. From millions of additions to the workforce to automation, India's gig economy is set for an upheaval. Will that be the end of the road for the millions who are always on the move but never move up?

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

Daaru, chakna and 'party all night': New videos from Bengaluru prison surfaceIn the latest videos, inmates can be seen using plates and mugs as musical instruments while shouting, "Party all night." The latest visuals come a day after the prison was at the centre of a storm following videos of several prisoners, including an ISIS recruiter and a rapist-murderer, receiving VIP treatment.

Tamil film body proposes revenue-sharing for star films, sets OTT release windowsThe Tamil Film Producers Council has introduced a new revenue-sharing model for big-budget films and implemented additional rules for film releases and industry practices, following decisions at its general body meeting in Chennai.

BBC director general and CEO resign over Trump speech editing scandalThe BBC has been embroiled in a spate of allegations that it had failed to maintain neutrality in its reporting, including in its coverage of the US President, Israel-Hamas war and over trans issues.

Longest US government shutdown close to ending: Trump as Senate reaches dealThe broader legislation would include three full-year appropriations bills addressing military construction and veterans affairs, the legislative branch, and the Department of Agriculture.

Blue Origin scrubs launch of Escapade Mars mission due to bad weatherThe Escapade mission, which seeks to study Mars' magnetosphere and atmospheric loss using twin small spacecraft named Blue and Gold, was scheduled to lift off today from Cape Canaveral.

Kranti Gaud's World Cup heroics help father reclaim Police job after 2012 setbackKranti Gaud's outstanding performance in the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 has led to her father's reinstatement in the police force. Kranti's father, Munna Singh Gaud, served as a constable in the police force before being dismissed in 2012, which pushed the family into financial turmoil.

As Delhi chokes, residents rally at India Gate demanding action, several detainedIndia Gate witnessed a nearly 30-minute protest before police began cracking down on demonstrators and started detaining them. One protester said they were not being allowed to protest peacefully and were instead being evacuated.

Lenny Wilkens, Hall of Famer and legendary NBA coach, dies at 88 Lenny Wilkens, the only person enshrined three times in the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame and the NBA's all-time wins leader for a generation, has died at the age of 88, leaving behind a transformative legacy in the sport.

Liverpool must focus on results instead of title race: Arne Slot after City loss Liverpool manager Arne Slot admitted that any talk of a Premier League title challenge was premature given his team's current form, as he candidly reflected on their 3–0 defeat to rivals Manchester City at the Etihad Stadium on Sunday.

Archer, Wood's pace will surprise ageing Australian batters in Ashes: Greg Chappell Former Australian captain Greg Chappell has cautioned Australia about England's formidable fast bowling lineup as the home side prepares to field its oldest Test team in over 90 years. The Ashes 2025-26 is set to begin on November 21 in Perth.

CSK hopeful of Sanju Samson trade, RR still weighing options: Report Chennai Super Kings are reportedly set to land Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson in a blockbuster IPL 2026 trade. The deal could see CSK stalwart Ravindra Jadeja and England all-rounder Sam Curran move to Rajasthan.

Prayed to God to win World Cup for fans and aspiring girls in India: Radha Yadav India spinner Radha Yadav has revealed that she was praying to god to help them win the Women's World Cup for their fans and aspiring young girls of India. India beat South Africa by 52 runs to clinch their maiden Women's World Cup in Navi Mumbai.

Australia linking cricket with politics not good for game: Afghanistan selector Former Afghanistan cricketer Asadullah Khan has criticised Australia for mixing politics with cricket due to women's rights issues in the country. Australia haven't kept any bilateral cricketing relations ever since Taliban's takeover of the country in September 2021.

AIFF moves to Supreme Court again after ISL tender receives no biddersIndian football faces fresh turmoil as the AIFF informed the Supreme Court that the ISL commercial rights tender received zero bids. With the league suspended, the sport's immediate future is now hanging by a thread.

Hockey player Julie Yadav dies after road accident in LucknowA young national-level athlete's life was cut short in a tragic road accident in Lucknow on Sunday. The death of 23-year-old sports teacher Julie Yadav has left her family and local sporting circles devastated.

Shafali Verma on year-long battle to claim World Cup glory: God rewarded my effortsShafali Verma's late call-up turned into a World Cup-defining masterclass as she powered India's historic title win. Her year of struggle, rebuilding and belief came together on the biggest night of her young career.

R Ashwin hails Jordan Hermann for heroic knock against India's Test bowlersRavichandran Ashwin took to social media to acknowledge South Africa A opener Jordan Hermann's composed 94-run knock against India A bowling attack consisting of senior Test stars namely Mohammed Siraj, Prasidh Krishna, Kuldeep Yadav and Akash Deep.

Guardiola and Klopp shared a rivalry that was deep-rooted in mutual respect.

Hasan Nawaz released from Pakistan's SL ODIs, tri-series squads after poor formPCB has decided to send Hasan Nawaz back to the domestic circuit and drop him from the Pakistan ODIs and T20I tri-series squads. Nawaz has been struggling for form recently as he failed in the South Africa ODI and T20I series.

Meghalya's Akash Choudhary hits 8 successive sixes, fastest 50 in first classMeghalaya's Akash Choudhary made history by hitting 8 successive sixes and the fastest fifty in first class cricket. He achieved the feat against Arunachal Pradesh's Limar Dabi during Ranji Trophy Plate League fixture in Surat.

Will speak to Yuvraj Singh about Abhishek Sharma's weakness: Ex-India cricketerFormer India cricketer Irfan Pathan joked that he will discuss about a weakness of Abhishek Sharma with Yuvraj Singh. Abhishek was the Player Of The Series against Australia in the T20I series.

Should CSK trade Ravindra Jadeja for Sanju Samson? Grave mistake, says ex-playerRumours suggest that Chennai Super Kings are ready to trade Ravindra Jadeja for Sanju Samson. Former cricketer Priyank Panchal warns CSK against what he calls is a grave mistake.

Ryan Williams joins Indian camp for Asian Cup qualifier vs BangladeshRyan Williams has joined the Indian national football team in Bengaluru. His inclusion highlights a strategic shift towards India's ambition in world football. Williams relinquished his Australian passport for this opportunity.

Sundar wins Impact Player award after India seal T20I series vs AustraliaWashington Sundar received the 'Impact Player of the Series' medal after India clinched the T20I series 2-1 in Australia. The all-rounder was all smiles as team operations manager Rahil Khaja presented him with the award.

Is Shubman Gill a burden to India's new-age T20I team?Shubman Gill is a generational talent, no doubt. But if his tempo disrupts India's T20I rhythm and forces others out of position, the question isn't whether he is good enough. It's whether he is the right fit for a side that has succeeded by attacking fearlessly.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
